text: After Hours is the seventh studio album by Canadian recording artist The Weeknd. It was released on March 20, 2020, by XO and Republic Records. The album broke the record for most pre-adds on Apple Music before release, with over one million pre-adds on the streaming service. == Singles == Four singles have been released from the album: "Heartless", "Blinding Lights", "In Your Eyes", and "Save Your Tears". The first was released on November 27, 2019, and the second was released two days later. "Heartless" became the singerâ€™s fourth number-one song on the Billboard Hot 100 in the United States. "Blinding Lights" became his fifth U.S. number-one, also breaking the record for most weeks in the top five of the Billboard Hot 100, with 28 weeks there so far. It also broke the record for most weeks at the top of the Hot 100 Airplay chart. It finished as the number-one song of 2020 in the US. "In Your Eyes" was released as a remix with American recording artist Doja Cat on May 20, 2020. Another remix with saxophonist Kenny G was released October 16, 2020. The album version of the song reached number 16 on the US Hot 100. "Save Your Tears" was released as the album's fourth single. After a remix of the song with American singer Ariana Grande was released, the song became the sixth US number-one for both artists. ==Tour== On February 3, 2021, Tesfaye announced a tour for the album, scheduled to begin in Vancouver on January 14, 2022. However, Tesfaye later revealed that he wanted to do a joint tour for both After Hours and the following album Dawn FM. This would require stadiums and not arenas, with new dates scheduled to begin summer 2022. == References == Notes Category:2020 albums Category:R&B; albums Category:The Weeknd albums
